data.title: Controller Extension Not Working After DisplayMode Change
- Fixed loop in the "letterUnderCursor" method
data.body:
which caused various "out of bounds" errors to occur when selecting text and positioning the cursor

To reproduce the bug (which is visible when selecting multiline text with the mouse, since the cursor tends to jump to the next line when it shouldn't) simply launch the TextArea test, empty the textarea, write a single word in it and double click somewhere to make it select the text, it should immediately crash. Once applied the fix a noticeable improvement to the text selection via mouse can be observed. Not to mention no more crashes.

data.title: Textarea in a ScrollPane
data.body:
This is basically the same problem discussed in #2320, which hasn't been investigated further. I tried to tackle it, and as suggested I found a way (pretty easy) to have the TextArea re-evaluate it's height based on the text. 

The TextArea pane resized as expected but, as MobiDevelop hinted, something does not work properly, since the ScrollPane where it was nested didn't seem to care about its child changing size, therefore not computing the new child height and updating the scrollbar. I've tried all possible methods that hinted to calling for a re-evaluation of the layout (invalidate, invalidateHierarchy, layout), but nothing made the ScrollPane aware of the TextArea new size.

I can't find a way to identify the problem, but if fixed, I'd be happy to contribute a mode switching for the TextArea which enables it to either behave as it is now (default) or switch to growing its size along with the contained text height. And perhaps a wordwrap on/off mode, since scrolling will be possible at that stage.

I've attached a test which only demonstrates how a TextArea currently fails to work compared to using a Label inside a ScrollPane (drop the class in the gdx-tests-lwjgl project sources and run it). 

Steps towards a solution:

**Step 1** is to make the TextArea resize itself when a new line gets added or removed (I checked the desired size every time the text had to be drawn, but it can easily be done only when needed, such as adding a new character to the text)

**Step 2** is to figure out why the ScrollPane ignores the new size.

[ScrollableTextAreaTest.zip](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/110058/ScrollableTextAreaTest.zip)

data.title: iOS bundle identifier without the 'IOSLauncher' suffix
data.body:
Hi guys,

First thing to mention, I'm a complete newbie to iOS development.

In the ios/robovm.properties generated by the setup app there is a line:
app.id=com.mygdx.game.IOSLauncher

As I understand, this will be used as a bundle identifier in App Store.

However, I don't understand why it has the '.IOSLauncher' suffix. For me, it would be awesome if my app had a bundle identifier just com.mydomain.myapp, without it.

Am I safe to just remove this suffix from the app.id property inside robovm.properties? Maybe somewhere else? What is the intention of this suffix? Maybe it's just a rudimental and should be removed from the setup?

Sorry, if it's something obvious, but I'm confused...

Kind regards,
Serhii

Really weird, happens when glBufferData is called in VertexBufferObject.java or something. Makes using ShapeRenderer not possible.

Which actually worries me a bit, I was debating on using LibGDX for something, but I'm unsure if there are other hidden issues at the moment with other portions of the library which fails on newer hardware or something.

data.title: A strange bug in fonts generation, since 1.8.0
data.body:
Hi guys,

I have created a simple project that shows this bug.

Please, clone it:
git clone https://github.com/serhii-k/test.git

It contains the ttf-file that contains only one character 'm', for the simplicity of this test.

When I generate a font, specifying:
parameter.characters = "m";

Then
font.draw(batch, "m", 300, 300);
displays this result:

![test1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10563821/12652654/778483f2-c5f4-11e5-8e7d-f7f507cfcbe9.png)

A workaround is to specify the characters parameter as "mm":
parameter.characters = "mm";

Then, the font is renderred correctly:

![test2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10563821/12652680/938fa536-c5f4-11e5-97d3-3167541ef7c4.png)

This issue was first seen since libGDX 1.8.0.

Kind regards,
Serhii

data.title: 1.9.1 crash on Android ARM64 device
Potential resize issue in 1.9.0 on iOS related to subviews.
data.body:
This may be by design and I've not looked into it too thoroughly as I've worked around the problem but thought I should draw attention to it.

I'm using AdMob banners, and when the screen was resized I destroyed the old AdView and created a new one to handle orientation change. When I upgraded to 1.9.0 the iOS version went into a resize loop when I started the game, where resize was being called on every game loop.

The iOS version now calls resize when a subview is added, this lead my code to destroy and recreate my adview, which then caused resize to be called again on the next loop.

The thing that makes this look like it might be a bug is that if I returned to the home screen of the iPad and back to the game, this stopped happening.

This will provide easy access to information about the GL connection, and allow us to robustly implement GL components that are sensitive to versions and platforms.

data.title: Load BitmapFont split in multiple regions in Skin
data.body:
Sometimes it's necessary to have a font atlas split in several images in the form:

```
Arial_0.png
Arial_1.png
Arial_2.png
```

If these images are packed (with other images), the resulting atlas contains regions with repeated names but different indexes, something like this:

```
...
Arial
  rotate: false
  xy: 2, 518
  size: 256, 256
  orig: 256, 256
  offset: 0, 0
  index: 0
Arial
  rotate: false
  xy: 2, 260
  size: 256, 256
  orig: 256, 256
  offset: 0, 0
  index: 1
Arial
  rotate: false
  xy: 260, 518
  size: 256, 256
  orig: 256, 256
  offset: 0, 0
  index: 2
...
```

If we use this atlas as an `Skin` atlas, the loading process ignores region indexes and it ends up with only 1 `TextureRegion` named `Arial` (the last one found). This makes impossible to build a `BitmapFont` using several `TextureRegion` (since the skin only contains 1). This PR fixes this.

To reproduce the problem:

``` java
public class LoadFont extends ApplicationAdapter{

    @Override
    public void create() {
        new Skin(Gdx.files.internal("skin.json"));
    }
}
```

using as assets [these files](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3300634/bitmapfont-assets.zip).

data.body: Nothing. It just acts like it's not there.

data.title: Loading images on GWT is lossy (particularly visible when using premultiplied alpha)
Context loss should be handled
data.body:
Afaik the GWT backend 'ignores' context loss i.e.  It doesn't restore shades and textures.
Context loss can occur on low end PCs.
See https://www.khronos.org/webgl/wiki/HandlingContextLost

data.title: touchDown events not firing correctly on Windows 10
1.9.0 missing resources
data.body: The latest release adds support for x86_64 and arm64-v8a, but the binary resources are missing, e.g.: [libgdx.so](https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/nightlies/dist/x86_64/libgdx.so).

data.title: Cell width with Value.percentWidth broken in debug mode
Android build.gradle error
data.body: After the 1.9.0 release, inside the task copyAndroidNatives, the line "file("libs/x86/").mkdirs();" is missing (overwritten by x86_64).

data.title: GLFW Controllers bug with more than one gamepad
data.body:
The new GLFW Backend works fine with one controller! However when a second one is connected (during the game, or before starting) it escalates completely. The "connect" method is called over and over again with new controller instances (the address differs). Also the button/axis events aren't reported from the second controller, however when you press a button on the first controller, it spams the event from tons of different controllers (I think each "new connected controller" reports the "new" event, so that as long as you press a button it gets reported instantly again.

The code I used : 

``` java
public class CursorTest extends ApplicationAdapter implements ControllerListener {
    @Override
    public void create() {
        Controllers.addListener(this);
    }

    @Override
    public void connected(Controller controller) {
        Gdx.app.log("Controller Event", controller.getName() + " (" + controller + ") connected!");
    }

    @Override
    public void disconnected(Controller controller) {
        Gdx.app.log("Controller Event", controller.getName() + " (" + controller + ") disconnected!");
    }

    @Override
    public boolean buttonDown(Controller controller, int buttonCode) {
        Gdx.app.log("Controller Event", controller.getName() + " (" + controller + ") pressed " + buttonCode);
        return false;
    }
    ...
}
```

An example output snippet(!) : 


I used two Xbox One Controllers. It differs not if they are connected wired or wireless.
[Java 8 u66 64 bit, libgdx 1.9.0/1.9.1-SNAPSHOT, Win10 64 bit]

data.title: Graphics class needs more configuration options for windowed mode
data.body:
This is a fairly easy change, so I will go ahead and submit a PR shortly.

Windowed mode needs additional configuration options: most importantly, setting the window to be resizable and decorated.

The overloaded method could look something like:
`public boolean setWindowedMode(int width, int height, boolean resizable, boolean decorated)`

Assuming we keep the old method that takes width and height and assumes false for both other params, this won't break any client code.

It seriously sucks right now that for dynamically changing these values you have to resort to interfacing directly with the backend, or in the case of LWJGL use hacky system properties.

_Additional note:_
I realize this is only relevant for desktop GDX, but the Android/iOS implementations can do the same thing that they do for the existing windowed mode method, immediately return false.

data.title: LWJGL3 - implement non-continuous rendering
data.body: Thanks for the new LWJGL3 backend! I needed non-continuous rendering, here is my implementation.

data.title: ShapeRenderer ignores Color alpha channel
Reduce number of instantiations within IntersectPolygons.
data.body: Removed unneeded List operations.

data.title: Don't create garbage in System.currentMillis
data.body: Date.now() is supported on every browser that supports WebGL, so it's save to use it instead of creating a new object on every call.
